Suicidal potential should be systematically assessed in psychiatry. It is based on a triple assessment: risk, urgency, dangerousness (RUD)

==Risk assessment
Risk assessment allows us to consider the factors that may influence the occurrence of death by suicide, based on individual, family, psychosocial and other factors.
{| class="wikitable"
! colspan="3" |Risk factors
|-
Individual factors
Family factors
! psychosocial factors
|-
|Psychiatric pathology :

*depression
*substance abuse, dependence
*psychotic disorders
*personality disorders

Personal history of ST

Low self-esteem
|
*Family history of death by suicide
*abuse, deprivation
|
*history of abuse in childhood
*Socio-economic situation: economic or professional difficulties;

*Social isolation separation or recent loss;
*difficulties with the law, failures;
*Developmental difficulties;
*The phenomenon of "contagion" following a suicide;
*Triggering event: recent event leading to a state of crisis in a subject.
|-
! colspan="3" |Protective factors
|-
! individual factors
Family factors
! psychosocial factors
|-
|
*Resilience = the ability to function adaptively in the face of stressful events and to cope with adversity,
*Problem-solving ability
|
* perceived socio-familial support
* having children at home
* sense of responsibility towards family
|
* religious beliefs
* social network
|}

==Estimacy assessment==
Assess the urgency or imminence of the act: the suicidal scenario, the absence of an alternative to suicide

*Low: thinking about suicide, no specific scenario, just flashes of inspiration
*Medium: scenario considered, but postponed
*High: clearly planned, act planned for the next few days

==Dangerousness assessment
Is based on the potential lethality and accessibility of the means envisaged.

question.title: What is the primary purpose of the RUD assessment in psychiatry?
question.description: A multiple-choice question about the RUD assessment

option_a.title: To identify the underlying causes of suicidal behavior
option_a.description: An incorrect option that is plausible but not entirely accurate

option_b.title: To assess the level of suicidal intent and the presence of protective factors
option_b.description: A correct option that accurately summarizes the RUD assessment

option_c.title: To determine the likelihood of a successful suicide attempt
option_c.description: An incorrect option that is related to the RUD assessment but not entirely accurate

option_d.title: To evaluate the effectiveness of treatment plans for suicidal patients
option_d.description: An incorrect option that is not directly related to the RUD assessment

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
